result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Leland M. Bertsinger was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is to be served consecutively to any sentence currently being served. Defendant was found to be eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of confinement. Defendant was not found to be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant has NO credit for time served.
Consecutive to: Sentence is to be served consecutively to any sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or to the Department of Corrections as is required in felony convictions.
Court ordered that 25% of all inmate funds be applied to the costs of the action-restitution has been paid from bond previously posted.
Restitution paid directly to the victim from bond previously posted
Defendant is to gain and maintain employment to the satisfaction of the agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant is to attend Victim Impact Panel session

Defendant is not to withdraw from any programming without consent of the agent and treatment provider

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. Only exception to this condition would be for employment purposes and then only with the approval of the agent.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.

The defendant shall not possess any firearms;

The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent. 
Defendant is to have a DOT assessment and follow the recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent. Defendant is to comply with the rules of supervision.
Consecutive to: Sentence is to be served consecutively to any sentence currently being served.
